posts.post_content:
I think that in actuality [Grave Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Titan) is the most powerful of the M11 Titans. While [Primeval Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primeval Titan) is of course the attractive one because of its immense card advantage and ramping capability, [Grave Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Titan) instead brings it with raw power. He has the advantage in damage-dealing over his red comrade [Inferno Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inferno Titan) in the obvious advantage that he can't be destroyed by [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) and in the more subtle advantage that he spreads his power over multiple bodies. By necessity, three creatures are much harder to remove than one. [Day of Judgmen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgmen)t is the only thing he fears.  
  
Although each of the Titans have a defining board presence, I think his is the most definitive. He can swing games around nearly immediately, providing three creatures for the price of one- one of those creatures being remarkably explosive and dangerous (himself, of course). He complicates combat with ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I think that in actuality Grave Titan is the most powerful of the M11 Titans. While Primeval Titan is of course the attractive one because of its immense card advantage and ramping capability, Grave Titan instead brings it with raw power. He has the advantage in damage-dealing over his red comrade Inferno Titan in the obvious advantage that he can't be destroyed by Doom Blade and in the more subtle advantage that he spreads his power over multiple bodies. By necessity, three creatures are much harder to remove than one. Day of Judgment is the only thing he fears.

Although each of the Titans have a defining board presence, I think his is the most definitive. He can swing games around nearly immediately, providing three creatures for the price of one- one of those creatures being remarkably explosive and dangerous (himself, of course). Posted By: deadeye1387 (8/24/2011 4:15:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
deathtouch lol. considering the fact that he's a 6/6, the deathtouch is more often that not useless.  
the zombie spawning is great, but i don;t find it that useful.  
i find [Primeval Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primeval Titan) a lot more useful in my green deck, then this in my blakc, as primeval opens up my next turn for a big bomb, like [Liege of the Tangle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liege of the Tangle), [Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer), [Engulfing Slagwurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Engulfing Slagwurm), or [Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger). and if i have [Rampaging Baloths](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rampaging Baloths) or [Grazing Gladehart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grazing Gladehart) out, then double landfall trigger.  
  
grave titan is a beast on his own, but i don't find him comboing spectacularly well with anything.  
still one of the best titants. #2 imo  
  
5/5
